item.title: Concerns Over BOE's Ability to Control Inflation Hits Sterling
item.description: Sterling’s positive reaction to Wednesday’s higher-than-expected U.K. inflation data was brief given concerns the BOE will struggle to contain price pressures due to factors outside its control, Commerzbank said.

item.title: Metals Mixed Amid Dollar Strength
item.description: Base metals were slightly firmer in London, with gold prices weaker, as worries over the U.S. debt ceiling and uncertainty about the Fed’s next move on rates, dominating markets.

item.title: Indonesia's Central Bank Stands Pat
item.description: Bank Indonesia maintained its benchmark seven-day reverse repo rate, as expected in a WSJ poll.

item.title: Oil Holds Gains Following US Stocks Data
item.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe but held onto the bulk of gains made this week following bullish inventory data and a warning from the Saudi Arabia energy minister.

item.title: German Consumer Morale to Improve Further
item.description: Germany’s forward-looking consumer-sentiment index forecast confidence to tick up to minus 24.2 in June, the strongest level since April 2022, according to GfK, as income expectations brightened.

item.title: Coca-Cola HBC Backs Outlook, Upgrades Targets
item.description: Coca-Cola HBC reiterated its fiscal 2023 guidance and updated its medium-term financial targets for revenue and earnings margin growth, reflecting a positive outlook for its markets.

item.title: Germany Enters Recession After GDP Revised Down
item.description: Germany’s GDP contracted 0.3% in the first quarter, according to a second estimate, as household expenditure was squeezed by high inflation.

item.title: Generali Backs Targets After Profits Jump
item.description: Generali confirmed the targets of its strategic plan for 2024 after it posted increased premiums and sharply higher profits in the first quarter.

item.title: Gucci-Owner Kering, Drugmaker GSK and Others Are Developing Global Targets on Nature Loss
item.description: Setting standards can help companies move from multiple and conflicting definitions of what is enough action for nature, to consistent and replicable guidance.

item.title: Greek-German Bond Yield Spread Expected to Stabilize Near Term
item.description: The 10-year Greek-German government bond yield spread has reached Citi’s target of 140 basis points and looks to stabilize there until the second election in June, it said.

item.title: United Utilities Profit Slides, Misses Consensus
item.description: United Utilities reported a 28% drop in underlying profit, reflecting lower consumption, higher inflation and increased operational costs.

item.title: Court Dismisses Ericsson Shareholder Lawsuit
item.description: Ericsson said a U.S court has rejected a claim by certain shareholders that the company misled investors over its business dealings and compliance in Iraq.

item.title: UK Car Manufacturing Rises for Third Consecutive Month
item.description: U.K. car production rose 9.9% in April, as the global shortage of chips and other components continued to ease.

item.title: More Airlines Are Encountering Near Collisions---and No One Knows Why
item.description: As summer travel season kicks off, regulators and carriers are scrambling to address potential safety threats; personnel strains stemming from the pandemic may be a factor.

item.title: Indian Shares Edge 0.1% Lower Amid Cautious Mood
item.description: India’s Sensex edged 0.1% lower to 61706.79 amid a cautious mood.

item.title: Inside Wall Street's Playbook to Prevent Debt-Ceiling Chaos
item.description: A default on U.S. Treasurys might not stop them from trading as the industry looks to minimize the potential damage.

item.title: Half-Empty a Year Ago, Cruises Are Now Packed Like Sardines
item.description: Crowds have returned to cruise ships to the point that some are oversold and even bumping passengers.

item.title: Target Lands in Culture-War Crosshairs Over Pride Month
item.description: The retailer’s halt to its sale of some Gay Pride items fuels criticism it gave in to pressure from anti-LGBT comments.

item.title: DeSantis officially joined the 2024 presidential race, but the Republican's planned campaign announcement on Twitter Spaces, featuring a conversation with Musk, was marred by technical issues.
item.description: DeSantis officially joined the 2024 presidential race, but the Republican’s planned campaign announcement on Twitter Spaces, featuring a conversation with Musk, was marred by technical issues.

item.title: Airlines and government officials are attempting to prevent another summer of aggravation for fliers, starting with the Memorial Day weekend.
item.description: Airlines and government officials are attempting to prevent another summer of aggravation for fliers, starting with the Memorial Day weekend.
